confession.seduction_context: when angry over the loss of some money, and swearing by the devil. Initially said 6 months earlier under torture, then corrected to 2 years. He gave her a piece of paper supposedly containing money which turned out to be empty. She renounced God when tempted with offer of money.
powder_types: powder given by Persin (threw it away)

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Withstood thumbscrews, but confessed when racked. Also given both tortillons and strappado.

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Confirmed basic confession, but withdrew accusations against the two women she had named.

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: PG (C.M. Rémy) asks for death sentence, naming her as a widow.

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks for further interrogation, in view of gaps in first confession. Also state that torture should not be renewed in afternoon without new indices, and court should abstain from this in future.

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Further interrogation ordered by Change de Nancy. Admitted renouncing God, described second encounter with Persin on road to Burthécourt.

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Catherine Dieudonnée
timeline.details: Court at Amance passes final sentence

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte Challot
accomplices_named.context: Said she had seen her at sabbat when under torture

accomplices_named.name: Jehenne Jacquot
accomplices_named.context: Said she had seen her at sabbat when under torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: Va t'en mechant, tu m'as trompé
notable_quotes.english: Go away, wicked one, you have deceived me
notable_quotes.context: When she discovered the paper with supposed money was empty, she said this to Persin and made the sign of the cross, and he disappeared.

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: qu'au mesme temps elle eust un grand remord de conscience d'avoit ainsi renié a Dieu, et ainsi adheré audit malingt esprit
notable_quotes.english: at the same time she had great remorse of conscience for having thus denied God, and thus adhered to the said evil spirit
notable_quotes.context: Describing her feelings after renouncing God

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine Dieudonnée
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en est toute innocente, et les maux arrivent incontinent aux personnes, et comme il plaist a Dieu
notable_quotes.english: that she is entirely innocent of this, and evils happen immediately to people, and as it pleases God
notable_quotes.context: Regarding the blindness of Chrestofle Austien's son after she asked for repayment of debt

relationships.evidence_text: Agreed that her son aged 20 had sometimes shared her bed, because they only had one
Asked whether her neighbour le Gros Symon had said that if she as a witch she should be burned

economic_context.details: Catherine mentioned loss of money which made her angry and led to the devil's approach. She asked for repayment of 9 gros owed to her son by Chrestofle Austien in order to buy bread, suggesting economic hardship.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he had told off her children while working at well of Sallonne
she asked him for payment of 9 gros owed by his father to her son, and allegedly gave him to the devil several times
le Gros Symon said that if she was a witch she should be burned

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Anne femme Anthoine Blaize
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Anne reproached her with her frequent quarrels with neighbours, and Catherine was angry to be reproached for fault she had not committed

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of someone who accused her of witchcraft

material_culture.object: piece of paper supposedly containing money
material_culture.context: Given by Persin during seduction, turned out to be empty
Given by Persin, she threw it away
Money owed by Chrestofle Austien to her son, she asked for it to buy bread
What she wanted to buy with the 9 gros
She and her son aged 20 sometimes shared one bed because they only had one

spatial_references.context: Primary location of the trial and residence of accused
Where Claudatte Challot and Jehenne Jacquot were from
Catherine was called witch on way back from Vic
Where Cezar Guillaumet told off her children while working
Where she met Persin again and he tried to throw her to the ground for intercourse
Destination of road where she met Persin second time
Where the court that passed final sentence was located

animal_predation: un mauvais chien (bad dog) - she dreamed it had her by the leg
economic_hardship_indicators: loss of money that made her angry
only had one bed to share with son

legal_context.redress_outcome: Had consulted a relative about being called witch, who advised her to let the matter pass

hearsay_chains.content: Accusations against Claudatte Challot and Jehenne Jacquot were withdrawn, saying they had been made from mere hearsay

emotional_state_notes: asked them to have pity on her
angry when reproached by Anne for frequent quarrels

third_parties.name: woman who called her witch a year earlier
third_parties.context: Only time she heard herself called witch before trial

third_parties.name: relative
third_parties.context: Advised her to let the matter pass when called witch

third_parties.name: Cezar Guillaumet (also Guillaume)
third_parties.context: From Château Salins, told off her children while working at well of Sallonne, allegedly died as result of her witchcraft

third_parties.name: Chrestofle Austien
third_parties.context: Father who owed money to her son

third_parties.name: son of Catherine Dieudonnée (aged 20)
third_parties.context: Owed money by Chrestofle Austien, sometimes shared bed with his mother because they only had one

third_parties.name: le Gros Symon
third_parties.context: Neighbour who said if she was a witch she should be burned, his child allegedly suffered twisted limbs

third_parties.name: Anne femme Anthoine Blaize
third_parties.context: Of Sallonne, reproached her with her frequent quarrels with neighbours, her child subsequently fell and broke a thigh

extraction_metadata.notes: Early stages of proceedings are missing. The accused was named by François Tannaire but no detailed witness testimony is recorded in this document. The trial record focuses heavily on the interrogations under torture and the confession. Catherine consistently denied causing any harm even under extreme torture (thumbscrews, rack, tortillons, strappado). She confessed to renouncing God and meeting the devil but expressed immediate remorse. She initially named two accomplices under torture but withdrew these accusations the next day. The Change de Nancy intervened to request further interrogation due to gaps in confession and to restrict torture practices. Notable that she threw away the powder given by the devil and resisted sexual advances. Economic hardship is evident (loss of money, needing small sum for bread, sharing one bed). The case shows typical witchcraft trial pattern: quarrel -> harm -> accusation, with multiple alleged victims being children of those who quarreled with or accused her.
